definition: to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He turned round and went back again.
sentences.chinese: 他掉踪降转头又回往了。

sentences.english: You walk hurriedly walk, don't turn around, don't with my tears flow.
sentences.chinese: 你要走就赶忙走，别转头，别对着我泪流。

sentences.english: It heads back to the conference room.
sentences.chinese: 接着它转头走回了会议室。

sentences.english: Now they finally turned against him.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他们终于调转头来。

sentences.english: So but then you did tell Mrs. Nagel.
sentences.chinese: 可你一转头就告诉了内格尔女士。

sentences.english: There were no symptoms or signs of vertigo on head-turning maneuvers.
sentences.chinese: 在转头动作时没有眩晕的症状和体征。

sentences.english: The dog saw it and run to his master as soon as it could.
sentences.chinese: 他的狗见了，急忙掉转头，追着主人狂奔。

sentences.english: The car turned round and went back again.
sentences.chinese: 小汽车掉转头又回去了。

sentences.english: When SSH jokes he will turn his head and look for KTH's reaction.
sentences.chinese: 宋承宪讲冷笑话的时候转头观察泰熙反应。

sentences.english: They turned round, and every man there saw his own cottage burning.
sentences.chinese: 大家转头一看，每个人都看到自己家的房子燃起大火。

sentences.english: Go ahead and do it now, make mistakes, learn from your mistakes and get better.
sentences.chinese: 现在就转头去做，从错误中学会经验，然后做得更好。

sentences.english: The surface of the drilling is not influences by grinding.
sentences.chinese: 转头的表面磨的很不光滑。

sentences.english: A head turning model for computer-aided character animation is presented in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文提出一个用于计算机动画的转头模型。

sentences.english: The Qin Dynasty isn't dealing with that hero, merely turns a head to ask Tang Ao.
sentences.chinese: 秦朝不在打理那个杨杰，而是转头问着唐傲。

sentences.english: If you slap her on her right cheek, she would turn her left towards you.
sentences.chinese: 你要是打了她右脸一巴掌，她会转头把左脸伸过来。

sentences.english: It is out of pity that you do not turn away your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 你不肯掉转头去不看我，那是出于怜悯。

definition: to turn one's head/to turn around
to turn one's head/in no time/in the twinkling of an eye
to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
to overdo it/to overstep the limit/excessively/above one's head/overhead
to raise one's head/to gain ground/account name, or space for writing the name on checks, bills etc
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to frown/to knit one's brow
promptly/at once
to have heard what was said
stunned/amazed
to look askance/cross or wall-eyed
in a low voice/softly
to cast a glance
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to stop/to halt/to cease
a glance/a quick look/a glimpse
